alert.note: Alert for Gove; Graham; Greeley; Logan; Norton; Sheridan; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 03 at 3:15AM CDT until April 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Today For Portions of East Colorado as the Fire Weather Watch has been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning. A Dangerous Fire Weather Day May Unfold On Tuesday For Portions of Northwest Kansas... .Critical fire weather conditions are again expected across Kit Carson and Cheyenne counties in Colorado today as a Red Flag Warning has been issued. Dangerous fire weather potential is increasing for portions of northwest Kansas. Gusty to strong southwest winds will eventually become northwesterly as a cold front moves through the area; gusty to strong winds are also expected behind the wind shift. Blowing dust is also possible due to multiple days of warm and breezy conditions across the area. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 004, 015, 016, 028, 029, 041, AND 042... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * Affected Area...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 004 Norton, Fire Weather Zone 015 Sheridan, Fire Weather Zone 016 Graham, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 029 Gove, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Winds...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph before becoming northwesterly at 25-35 gusting up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...Around 15 percent. * Impacts...Any ignition will have the potential to exhibit extreme fire behavior, and burn out of control. High end dangerous wildfire potential exists. An expected wind shift to the northwest is expected to occur Tuesday afternoon leading to unpredictable wildfire behavior. Blowing dust may also occur, leading to poor visibility for first responders addressing a fire if one is occurring.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.

area.areaDesc: Gove; Graham; Greeley; Logan; Norton; Sheridan; Wichita
